Description: Fragment of flattened handle of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora at neck join. Clay near fine brown. Rectangular stamp with Greek inscription.
Curator's comments: Petrie Diary 1884-5 (EES Archive XVII 47) p. 59, 22? Name Daliades. The rare type is discussed by Ph. Seroglou in her article on the stamped handles from the sanctuary of Isis in Rhodes town in the Festschrift for Michalis Tiverios, Κεράμεως Παῖδες, 327-8.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.0452)
